intro: Rinorea deflexiflora, commonly known as the flexile rinorea, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
